text: The following is a list of the top National Football League (NFL) quarterbacks in regular season wins. In the NFL, the starting quarterback is the only position that is credited with records of wins and losses. Tom Brady holds the record for the most regular season wins with 251. Brady also holds the record for the most postseason wins with 35. ==List== This list shows the top 100 NFL quarterbacks by regular season wins since 1950. Seasons ;Notes *The NFL did not count ties in the standings until . * Bobby Layne is started all 12 games for the Bulldogs (NFL) in 1949. That team finished 1–10–1. His official post-1949 won–loss–tied record of 80–51–4 (.607). With the 1949 Bulldogs season, his overall estimated won–loss–tied record is 81–61–5 (.568). *The 1950 Baltimore Colts are no longer playing. They are not related to the current Indianapolis Colts. *Conerly is estimated to have a 7–8–0 record as a starter from 1948–1949. His official post-1949 record is 58–31–1 (). With the two seasons in 1948 and 1949, his overall estimated record is 65–39–1 (). *Graham also started 55 games for the Cleveland Browns when they were in the All-America Football Conference (1946–1949). He is estimated to have gone 48-4-3. His NFL record winning percentage is 57–13–1 (). Including his time in the AAFC, his overall estimated professional record is 105–17–4 (). == Postseason wins == The following 41 quarterbacks have won at least five postseason games during their career: Key ^ Inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame ‡ Retired but not yet eligible for the Hall of Fame * Active player Rank Player Wins 1 ‡ Tom Brady 35 2 ^ Joe Montana 16 3 ^ Terry Bradshaw 14 * Patrick Mahomes ^ John Elway ^ Peyton Manning 6 ^ Brett Favre 13 ‡ Ben Roethlisberger 9 ^ Troy Aikman 11 * Aaron Rodgers ^ Roger Staubach 12 * Joe Flacco 10 13 ‡ Drew Brees 9 ^ Jim Kelly Donovan McNabb ^ Bart Starr ^ Kurt Warner * Russell Wilson 19 ‡ Eli Manning 8 ^ Dan Marino Jim Plunkett ^ Steve Young Rank Player Wins 23 ^ Ken Stabler 7 24 ^ Bob Griese 6 Phil Simms ^ Fran Tarkenton Joe Theismann ^ Johnny Unitas 29 * Josh Allen 5 Mark Brunell * Joe Burrow ^ Len Dawson Jake Delhomme Trent Dilfer Matt Hasselbeck ^ Sid Luckman Steve McNair Craig Morton ‡ Philip Rivers Mark Rypien Danny White == Related pages == *List of most consecutive starts by a National Football League quarterback == References == Quarterback wins leaders Wins
title: List of National Football League career quarterback wins leaders
